item.title: Hanoi opens 3 MIA search areas, releases letters
item.description: "If Dad calls, tell him I got too close to being dead but I'm O.K. I was real lucky. I'll write again soon."
item.media:text: "If Dad calls, tell him I got too close to being dead but I'm O.K. I was real lucky. I'll write again soon."

item.title: Baseball champ facing possible failure in business
item.description: Three-time World Series champion Curt Schilling was always more than a big-league pitcher.
item.media:text: Three-time World Series champion Curt Schilling was always more than a big-league pitcher.

item.title: Sandusky judge denies accusers' bid for pseudonyms
item.description: Alleged victims of former Penn State assistant football coach Jerry Sandusky will have to testify using their real names, and tweets or other electronic communications by reporters will not be permitted during the trial, the judge ruled Monday.
item.media:text: Alleged victims of former Penn State assistant football coach Jerry Sandusky will have to testify using their real names, and tweets or other electronic communications by reporters will not be permitted during the trial, the judge ruled Monday.

item.title: Jaguars' Blackmon appears in court on DUI count
item.description: Jacksonville Jaguars first-round draft pick Justin Blackmon has appeared in an Oklahoma courtroom for the first time since his weekend arrest for suspicion of drunken driving.
item.media:text: Jacksonville Jaguars first-round draft pick Justin Blackmon has appeared in an Oklahoma courtroom for the first time since his weekend arrest for suspicion of drunken driving.

item.title: Concert for queen draws huge crowds, husband ill
item.description: LONDON (Reuters) - Robbie Williams kicked off a concert outside Queen Elizabeth's sumptuous London residence on Monday before huge crowds gathered to celebrate the monarch's 60 years on the throne, but the event was overshadowed by news her husband had been hospitalized. Prince Philip, who turns 91 next weekend, was taken to hospital with a bladder infection in what Buckingham Palace said was a "precautionary" move. ...

item.title: 'Snow White' takes bite out of N. America box office
item.description: "Snow White and the Huntsman" was the fairest of them all at the North American box office over the weekend with a $56.2 million debut, industry figures showed Monday.
item.media:text: "Snow White and the Huntsman" was the fairest of them all at the North American box office over the weekend with a $56.2 million debut, industry figures showed Monday.

item.title: Starbucks buys bakery to improve pastry offerings
item.description: Starbucks Corp. is looking to expand its food business, with a $100 million cash deal to buy a small bakery chain.

item.title: A mixed close on Wall Street as calm returns
item.description: U.S. stocks are closing mixed after a calm trading day interrupted last week's spasm of fearful selling.
item.media:text: U.S. stocks are closing mixed after a calm trading day interrupted last week's spasm of fearful selling.

item.title: Obama, Romney campaign advisers trade blame on job creation
item.description: WASHINGTON (Reuters) - Advisers to President Barack Obama and presumptive Republican presidential nominee Mitt Romney squared off on Sunday over job creation in a debate which, following Friday's weak jobs report, promises to be a deciding factor in the November vote. Ed Gillespie, a senior adviser to Romney, citing Obama's healthcare reform law and a decision to put a major oil pipeline on hold, said on "Fox News Sunday" that Obama's policies have put a damper on job creation. "The problem is this administration and this president's policies are hostile to job creators," Gillespie said. ...
item.media:text: WASHINGTON (Reuters) - Advisers to President Barack Obama and presumptive Republican presidential nominee Mitt Romney squared off on Sunday over job creation in a debate which, following Friday's weak jobs report, promises to be a deciding factor in the November vote. Ed Gillespie, a senior adviser to Romney, citing Obama's healthcare reform law and a decision to put a major oil pipeline on hold, said on "Fox News Sunday" that Obama's policies have put a damper on job creation. "The problem is this administration and this president's policies are hostile to job creators," Gillespie said. ...

item.title: Pope No. 2 attacks leaks, says Benedict undeterred
item.description: Pope Benedict XVI's deputy has denounced the continued leaks of Vatican documents and says the pope isn't intimidated by the "fierce" and "organized" breach of trust.
item.media:text: Pope Benedict XVI's deputy has denounced the continued leaks of Vatican documents and says the pope isn't intimidated by the "fierce" and "organized" breach of trust.

item.title: New US legislation aims to curb cancer drug shortages
item.description: A critical shortage of generic drugs in the United States, particularly in cancer care, could be curbed with legislation now being hammered out by the US House and Senate, doctors said on Monday.
item.media:text: A critical shortage of generic drugs in the United States, particularly in cancer care, could be curbed with legislation now being hammered out by the US House and Senate, doctors said on Monday.

item.title: Sharapova stumbles to French Open win; Li loses
item.description: On days like these, when so little goes right and so much goes awry, Maria Sharapova tosses away the strategies and scouting reports her coach devises and, well, does whatever it takes to win.
item.media:text: On days like these, when so little goes right and so much goes awry, Maria Sharapova tosses away the strategies and scouting reports her coach devises and, well, does whatever it takes to win.

item.title: G7 to hold emergency euro zone talks, Spain top concern
item.description: TORONTO/BERLIN (Reuters) - Finance chiefs of the Group of Seven leading industrialized powers will hold emergency talks on the euro zone debt crisis on Tuesday in a sign of heightened global alarm about strains in the 17-nation European currency area. With Greece, Ireland and Portugal all under international bailout programs, financial markets are anxious about the risks from a seething Spanish banking crisis and a June 17 Greek election that may lead to Athens leaving the euro zone. ...
item.media:text: TORONTO/BERLIN (Reuters) - Finance chiefs of the Group of Seven leading industrialized powers will hold emergency talks on the euro zone debt crisis on Tuesday in a sign of heightened global alarm about strains in the 17-nation European currency area. With Greece, Ireland and Portugal all under international bailout programs, financial markets are anxious about the risks from a seething Spanish banking crisis and a June 17 Greek election that may lead to Athens leaving the euro zone. ...

item.title: Chesapeake looks to sell some Ohio acreage: adviser
item.description: NEW YORK (Reuters) - Chesapeake Energy Corp is looking to sell about 337,000 acres of its holdings in Ohio, as it works to raise money to meet an expected cash shortfall, according to a prospectus released by one of its advisers. The holdings on the block include some in the Utica shale. The prospectus was posted on the website of Meagher Energy Advisors, an energy-focused asset acquisition and divestiture firm that has sold assets for Chesapeake in the past. According to Meagher, Chesapeake plans to focus its development in the Utica shale on areas where its holdings are more concentrated. ...

item.title: Labour widens lead over Conservatives - poll
item.description: LONDON (Reuters) - Labour party is extending its opinion poll lead over the Conservatives, a new survey showed on Monday, highlighting ebbing confidence in the government's economic competence after a week of budget U-turns. Pollster Angus Reid found that Labour had extended its lead by four points to 45 percent since April while the Conservatives were unchanged on 29 percent, echoing other low poll ratings since the government's badly received annual budget in March. ...

item.title: NASCAR suspends Kurt Busch 1 weekend
item.description: NASCAR has suspended Kurt Busch for one week for verbally abusing a media member.

item.title: Iowa police: Nebraska mom strangled son, herself
item.description: Police say a Nebraska mom who disappeared last month with her son strangled the 10-year-old boy before strangling herself in the woods of an Iowa state park.

item.title: US markets close mixed in bumpy trade
item.description: US stocks closed mixed Monday after a day of bumpy trade, as eurozone turmoil kept a shadow over with the markets.
item.media:text: US stocks closed mixed Monday after a day of bumpy trade, as eurozone turmoil kept a shadow over with the markets.

item.title: Merkel open to idea of European banking union
item.description: German Chancellor Angela Merkel said Monday that she was open to establishing a European banking authority as a long-term solution to the continent's financial crisis. Her support as leader of the EU's biggest economy could be crucial for the concept, which aims to strengthen the eurozone and calm jittery markets.
item.media:text: German Chancellor Angela Merkel said Monday that she was open to establishing a European banking authority as a long-term solution to the continent's financial crisis. Her support as leader of the EU's biggest economy could be crucial for the concept, which aims to strengthen the eurozone and calm jittery markets.

item.title: Big 10 prefers plus-1 to 4-team playoff
item.description: Big Ten administrators would prefer a plus-one system over a four-team playoff to determine a national champion if the BCS can't be maintained in its current form.

item.title: Worries about slowing global economy pressures oil
item.description: The price of oil recovered a bit Monday after last week's drubbing.

item.title: Fighting at Tripoli airport, gunmen surround planes
item.description: TRIPOLI (Reuters) - Clashes broke out between rival Libyan militias at Tripoli's international airport on Monday after angry gunmen drove armed pickup trucks on to the tarmac and surrounded planes, forcing the airport to cancel flights. In a fresh challenge to the interim government's weak authority, members of the al-Awfea Brigade occupied the airport for several hours demanding the release of their leader whom they said was being held by Tripoli's security forces. Brigades of former fighters said they had restored calm at the airport by Monday evening. ...

In a fresh challenge to the interim government's weak authority, members of the al-Awfea Brigade occupied the airport for several hours demanding the release of their leader whom they said was being held by Tripoli's security forces. Brigades of former fighters said they had restored calm at the airport by Monday evening. ...

item.title: Lepchenko loses but gains likely spot at Olympics
item.description: On the day Varvara Lepchenko became the last American singles player to exit the French Open, she also learned she's in line to become one of the few Americans to wear the red, white and blue at the Olympics.
item.media:text: On the day Varvara Lepchenko became the last American singles player to exit the French Open, she also learned she's in line to become one of the few Americans to wear the red, white and blue at the Olympics.

item.title: Grain elevator explosion victim remains devastated
item.description: A man who was badly burned when an Illinois grain elevator exploded two years ago knows he may ultimately get a big chunk of the $181 million that a federal jury awarded him and two co-workers who were seriously injured in the blast. He just doesn't know how much good it will do him.
item.media:text: A man who was badly burned when an Illinois grain elevator exploded two years ago knows he may ultimately get a big chunk of the $181 million that a federal jury awarded him and two co-workers who were seriously injured in the blast. He just doesn't know how much good it will do him.

item.title: Attorney: George Zimmerman was confused, fearful
item.description: The former neighborhood watch leader charged with fatally shooting Trayvon Martin was confused and fearful when he and his wife misled court officials about their finances during an April bond hearing that allowed him to be released from jail, his attorney said Monday.
item.media:text: The former neighborhood watch leader charged with fatally shooting Trayvon Martin was confused and fearful when he and his wife misled court officials about their finances during an April bond hearing that allowed him to be released from jail, his attorney said Monday.

item.title: Craig, Cardinals stop 5-game skid, beat Mets
item.description: Allen Craig hit a tiebreaking, two-run homer in the eighth inning and the St. Louis Cardinals found a bit of missing pop, beating the New York Mets 5-4 Monday and stopping their season-worst losing streak at five.
item.media:text: Allen Craig hit a tiebreaking, two-run homer in the eighth inning and the St. Louis Cardinals found a bit of missing pop, beating the New York Mets 5-4 Monday and stopping their season-worst losing streak at five.

item.title: NFL to start hiring possible replacement refs
item.description: The NFL will start hiring and training possible replacement officials with a deal not yet completed with the NFL Referees Association.

item.title: Queen's jubilee concert: live report
item.description: 1950 GMT: Tom Jones up now waving the flag for Wales.

item.title: IRA supporters force Olympic torch to alter course
item.description: Irish Republican Army supporters clashed with police Monday and forced Olympic torch organizers to divert the route of their relay, marring what had been a jubilant day's procession through a sun-soaked Northern Ireland.
item.media:text: Irish Republican Army supporters clashed with police Monday and forced Olympic torch organizers to divert the route of their relay, marring what had been a jubilant day's procession through a sun-soaked Northern Ireland.

item.title: Syria rebels no longer respect truce, blame Assad
item.description: BEIRUT (Reuters) - Syrian rebels said on Monday they were no longer bound by a U.N.-backed truce because President Bashar al-Assad had failed to observe their Friday deadline to implement the ceasefire and had only attacked government forces to defend "our people". A Syrian opposition watchdog appeared to underline the rebel statement by saying at least 80 Syrian troops were killed in a surge of attacks at the weekend. International mediator Kofi Annan, due to brief the U.N. ...

item.title: US stocks waver as calm returns to market
item.description: Calm returned to the stock market Monday after a spasm of fearful selling last week. Major indexes were mixed in afternoon trading after being down for most of the day.
item.media:text: Calm returned to the stock market Monday after a spasm of fearful selling last week. Major indexes were mixed in afternoon trading after being down for most of the day.

item.title: US concerned by Azeri-Armenian tensions
item.description: Secretary of State Hillary Rodham Clinton on Monday kicked off three days of diplomacy in Europe's Caucasus, expressing concern about recent clashes between Armenia and Azerbaijan as she hopes to mediate progress on a slew of trade and territorial disputes.
item.media:text: Secretary of State Hillary Rodham Clinton on Monday kicked off three days of diplomacy in Europe's Caucasus, expressing concern about recent clashes between Armenia and Azerbaijan as she hopes to mediate progress on a slew of trade and territorial disputes.

item.title: Nun's book on masturbation slammed by Vatican
item.description: The Vatican slammed a "sexual morality" book written by an American Catholic nun on Monday, warning believers to stay away from the tome which justifies masturbation, homosexuality and divorce.
item.media:text: The Vatican slammed a "sexual morality" book written by an American Catholic nun on Monday, warning believers to stay away from the tome which justifies masturbation, homosexuality and divorce.

item.title: Wisconsin recall battle finally goes to voters
item.description: The battle over Gov. Scott Walker's agenda has attracted millions of dollars from out of state, campaign volunteers from across the country and months of concentrated attention from the two major political parties.
item.media:text: The battle over Gov. Scott Walker's agenda has attracted millions of dollars from out of state, campaign volunteers from across the country and months of concentrated attention from the two major political parties.

item.title: 2 pilots die as firefighting plane crashes in Utah
item.description: A firefighting aircraft crashed into rugged terrain near the Utah-Nevada border as it dropped retardant on a 5,000-acre wildfire, killing the two Idaho men on board.
item.media:text: A firefighting aircraft crashed into rugged terrain near the Utah-Nevada border as it dropped retardant on a 5,000-acre wildfire, killing the two Idaho men on board.

item.title: Xbox 360 synchs with smartphones and tablets
item.description: Microsoft on Monday continued its quest to be at the heart of home entertainment by synching Xbox 360 videogame consoles to smartphones and tablets while adding more blockbuster content.
item.media:text: Microsoft on Monday continued its quest to be at the heart of home entertainment by synching Xbox 360 videogame consoles to smartphones and tablets while adding more blockbuster content.

item.title: Microsoft unveils new streaming, sharing app at E3
item.description: The Xbox 360 is getting a little smarter.
item.media:text: The Xbox 360 is getting a little smarter.

item.title: Libyan militia takes control of Tripoli airport
item.description: A group of disgruntled militiamen took over the country's main airport on Monday, storming it with heavy machine guns and armored vehicles and forcing airport authorities to divert flights, a security official said.

item.title: Rep. Issa won't have to testify in Clemens trial
item.description: The judge in the Roger Clemens perjury trial has ruled that defense lawyers can't call Rep. Darrell Issa as a witness.
